Headers: A Minecraft Player Set Out to Build the Known Universe, Block by Block
Descriptions: Christopher Slayton, 18, spent two months intricately designing the planets. He even went skydiving to get a better appreciation for Earth.

Headers: Under New Order, Europeans Can Complain to U.S. About Data Collection
Descriptions: An executive order, signed by President Biden, brings the United States and the European Union closer to a broader deal on the transfer of digital data.

Headers: Elon’s Hidden Motives + A Meetup in the Metaverse
Descriptions: Is the $44 billion  Twitter deal actually for real this time? Our hosts disagree.

Headers: This Is Life in the Metaverse
Descriptions: Every hour of the day and night with the gamers, parents, insomniacs, preteens and aspiring comedians who are the earliest adopters of the immersive, three-dimensional internet that Mark Zuckerberg has bet the future of his company on.

Headers: Biden Visits IBM to Promote Investments in U.S. Semiconductor Production
Descriptions: President Biden traveled to Poughkeepsie, N.Y., to connect a $20 billion investment by IBM to the bipartisan bill meant to spur production of critical microchips.

Headers: Judge Grants Elon Musk’s Request to Delay Trial With Twitter
Descriptions: A judge in Delaware gave Mr. Musk until Oct. 28 to complete the deal. The trial, which was set to start in a little more than a week, could still happen in November.

Headers: What Does X Mean to Elon Musk?
Descriptions: The letter X has had significance in the billionaire’s life, from his early days as an entrepreneur to his personal life and now to his pursuit of Twitter.

Headers: News on Fringe Social Sites Draws Limited but Loyal Fans, Report Finds
Descriptions: The appeal of platforms like Parler, Truth Social and Telegram is another symptom of the partisan divide in media, according to the Pew Research Center.

Headers: Elon Musk Offered to Buy Twitter at a Lower Price in Recent Talks
Descriptions: Before Mr. Musk renewed his $44 billion proposal, he and the company haggled in discussions that ultimately did not advance.

Headers: Former Uber Security Chief Found Guilty of Hiding Hack From Authorities
Descriptions: A jury found Joe Sullivan, who led security at the ride-hailing company, guilty on two different counts. The case could change how security professionals handle data breaches.
